alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 8:52PM EST until January 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following river in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... White River .Upwards of two inches of rainfall last weekend put several rivers across central and southern Indiana into flood. Minor flooding is now confined to the White River from about Petersburg southward in southwest Indiana. The river level is expected to linger near flood stage through Tuesday night in the Petersburg area, and fall from about 3 feet above flood stage in the Hazleton area through Wednesday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Hazleton. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flood waters cover the Hazleton softball field. Pottsville Road is underwater and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river will fall to 17.1 feet and then begin rising early Monday afternoon. It will then rise again to 17.4 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall to 17.1 feet and then begin rising early Tuesday afternoon. It will then rise again to 17.3 feet Tuesday evening. It will fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 845 PM CST /945 PM EST/.
